explanations.b: Correct. PSK stands for Phase Shift Keying, where data is transmitted by changing the phase of the carrier signal.

questions.question: In 8PSK, how many bits are represented per symbol?

explanations.b: Correct. 8PSK transmits 3 bits per symbol because logâ‚‚(8) = 3.

questions.question: What type of noise is usually considered in digital communication simulations?

explanations.b: Correct. AWGN (Additive White Gaussian Noise) is the standard model for noise in digital communication systems.
